intro: Quechualia cardenasii, commonly known as the Cárdenas quechualia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, thriving in cool, humid climates. Its leaves are simple and opposite, often with a glossy surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Quechualia cardenasii is considered a rare and endangered species.
